Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ BEFORE STAYING!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishfan7399
Reviews.Content: I would have to say I never write reviews because I am pretty easy to please. Give me a room with a decent bed and i am okay. I guess there is always a first. Shower has no hot water. son found bugs in his bed, Got up in middle of night to use bathroom and a roach ran across the wall. Beds areas comfortable as a roll away and the room smells. Said it was remodeled must have been on outside because rooms have not been touched. We asked if the offered a AAA discount and they were rude and said that our card was charged when we reserved so no. They will tell you what do you expect they are a 2 star and they shouldn't be even that. If you are looking for something a little cheaper find a hotel that offers shuttle to Universal and pay the extra couple dollars. I couldnt wait to leave and I was suppose to be having fun. Right at the bottom of the Universal park they have a parking lot where you can park and take the Universal shuttle to the top. that is my recommendation not to stay at this hotel. Terrible service and Terrible rooms. I felt I had bugs climbing on me all night.

Reviews.Title: “Only as a last resort should you stay...”
Reviews.Author: zombielova
Reviews.Content: Only as a last resort should you stay here. The only good quality about it is that it's a couple blocks over from Hollywood Blvd. & the walk of fame. We were afraid to take our shoes off because the carpet was sticky & dirty, the AC & t.v. didn't work, & the refrigerator didn't get cold. Only the bare minimum was provided. We couldn't wait to leave. I don't know how the other moteld were on sunset but I'm sure there are better ones than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hollywood location...”
Reviews.Author: LDN_2009
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Studio Inn is brilliantly located. Positioned on Sunset Blvd., directly below the busiest stretch of Hollywood Blvd., it's a fifteen minute walk or less to the centre of things. And surrounded by shops, restaurants, cinemas and other hotels it's a bustling and safe area. The rooms are basic but have everything you need and there's plenty of parking and the rates are great. Simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and incredibly good value, but some rough edges”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugged
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from April 10-15, 2010. Even though I arrived late at night (thanks to flight delays), the front desk staff were there and very helpful. The room facilities were basic, but they were clean and they worked. There was no landline phone in my room, but there was free wifi. So if you're coming from overseas and not bringing your laptop (which you can use to communicate via email, Skype etc.) with you), you need to be prepared for that. But for such an amazingly low room cost, it's hardly something and not really something you can complain about. The walls are quite thin and I could hear normal activity in the room next to me, though it didn't give me any problem sleeping when I needed to sleep. Car parking was plentiful and secure. If you need them, there are strip malls where you can buy stuff to eat and drink within 2-3 blocks. The Google map is a bit deceptive. The distance to the 'touristy' bits of Hollywood is a little bit further than it looks. It took me 17 minutes on foot to the Egyptian Theatre (on the corner of Hollywood and Las Palmas), and I'm a reasonably fast walker, used to travelling on foot within English cities. If you're visiting to see the tourist side of Hollywood and don't mind a bit of exercise, you can leave your car at the motel and explore on foot, but be prepared for a fair bit of walking. Unless you're a very slow walker, Hollywood and Vine subway station to this motel will take you no more than 25 minutes, and from there, a lot of other places in LA are available without needing to rent a car. The only thing I was not impressed with was that on my last day, I asked if I could stay in my room for a couple of hours after the 1100 check-out deadline. My flight was late afternoon. No way, I was told - out by 11 or pay for another night. The impression I got was that there wasn't exactly an influx of new guests waiting to move in, and that this was pure inflexibility. But this is such a great location for the price that this is a very minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: grimbo77
Reviews.Content: great location being only 2 blocks from hollywood boulevard and on pick up route for tour bus. 2 repairs reported and fixed quickly. friendly staff. only downside was no phone in room.

Reviews.Title: “Wierd room smelled funny but good location, kind of.”
Reviews.Author: Tactic13
Reviews.Content: Rolling onto the Sunset strip at 11:00 pm was a bit overwhelming. Being on a budget its tough to pick a place that doesn't look a bit schetchy. This place had a parking area that was protected from the street somewhat, I think thats why we picked it. The fellow working the desk was strange, not friendly, but not offensive. The price was good so we took the room. The good sized room was clean except for some hair in the bath tub. It smelled a bit funny but we quickly got used to it. The comforters looked like they came from another era, but they were new, wierd! The steel grate on the window made me feel safe. There was a minifridge and a free porn channel. This place was fine for one night but no more than that. Great location though, walking distance to hollywood blvd.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Worst Hotel We've Stayed In! EVER!”
Reviews.Author: juanvaldez001
Reviews.Content: Located on the Sunset Strip between a Strip Club and a public library with drunks sleeping on the sidewalk. The manager was rude, and obviously was the cause of of the hotels decline. At one point in time someone had made the attempt to remodel the hotel, but had never bothered to follow up with cleaning the rooms afterwards. The carpet was matted down and black with dirt and sticky to walk on (your feet or socks were black within minutes). The sheets were not changed during our stay, and we suspected they may not have been before we moved in. The towels were thin, and we received no hand towels, just facecloths and bath towels. The room wasn't serviced until almost 6pm. The parking lot is cramped and has fewer spaces than rooms, we just parked and walked everywhere. We booked through Expedia and I'm not quite sure why they rated it a 2 Star hotel. I think someone cooked the books on this one. And I can't quite believe the review here that someone stayed 3 months in this hotel?!!?!!

Reviews.Title: “cheap motel in mexican area”
Reviews.Author: arthur55
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 10 days, well located motel near la brea ave, you can walk north to hollywood blvd and graumans theatre with stars messages in concrete on footpath, etc. a car and a cellphone would be useful staff mexican and not really friendly, welcoming or helpful, no outgoing phone calls allowed, go out to street and try to find a working payphone, my room was kept clean but as is usual in USA had no fridge or coffee making facilities, my room was quiet at night, even though motel is on sunset blvd its a druggy area with celebrities checking in for prostitutes and to buy and use drugs, some have died in nearby motels from an overdose. mostly a mexican area with some blacks, as a white I stood out but was never bothered, its handy to shops, resteraunts, take away food places and quite safe to walk the streets in daylight as I found and was told by locals bus along la brea ave useful, goes south to la brea tar pits and museums, also motel is fairly close to Greyhound bus hollywood terminal

Reviews.Title: “One Half Star at Best!”
Reviews.Author: jacksonatl
Reviews.Content: First of all Hotwire classified this hotel as a two star, so when I accepted the price, was shocked to find that this was the hotel! Let's see: 1) No ice or icemaker on premises 2) 11:00 AM Check-Out 3) Parking was a mess 4) No visitors allowed 5) No iron/ironing board/hair dryer 6) Ghetto part of Sunset Blvd. 7) Outside of motel looked run--down 8) Totally overpriced for what you get! 9) Smallest room I have ever stayed in--not even a small table 10) No coffee You are better off staying at a Motel 6 or Days Inn. At least they would have basic amenities. The price was NOT a two-star price either....$79

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Jimmyshah
Reviews.Content: This establishment is in the heart of hollywood and has the best economical rates in that area with newly remodeled rooms. The management is very friendly and willing to help you whenever u need. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Dissatisfied911
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening only to find that this is not a hotel but rather a motel where the crack addicts take thier cheap hookers. Our shower curtain was full of mold, there was a door in the bedroom that lead who knows where that did not lock, a small table had been strategically placed in front of it. As soon as I turned on the tv my children and I came face to face with hard core porn. The least the receptionist could have done was issue a warning as he saw plain as day that I had childen with me. The heater did not work and there were cigarette burns in what little bedding we did have (a nasty dirty comforter and a sheet). We left in middle of the night because my children were very uncomfortable and could not possibly sleep there. Had we not have already prepaid we would have driven away immediatly.

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Studio Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 7160 West Sunset Boulevard, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90046
